events.name: Special July Meetup - Ubisoft Game Security Workshop
events.description: This July, Ubisoft Singapore will be co-organising a Special Meetup Edition with Div0 to share how security (anti-cheating and anti-hacking) is applied in video games. RSVP Now: https://www.evite.com/event/02B8VVFW6AZXVI67OEPII5UEHADDUY/rsvp IMPORTANT NOTERSVP here (on Meetup.com) doesn't constitute as successful registering of the event. Attendees have to register via https://www.evite.com/event/02B8VVFW6AZXVI67OEPII5UEHADDUY/rsvp
events.location: Ubisoft Singapore,  1 Fusionopolis Walk Solaris, South Tower, #11-05

events.name: Introduction to QTUM and development on QTUM
events.description: Hi QTUM developers! Hope you have all been doing well. In our next talk, we will be reprising a short introduction of the main features of QTUM blockchain, as well as going over the latest technical developments on QTUM, including x86VM and QTUM enterprise! We will end off with a short introduction to hands-on development on QTUM. Hope to see you all there! :)

events.name: Write Your Name to the Blockchain
events.description: Please register here, https://www.sginnovate.com/events/introduction-qtum-and-solidity-development-qtum Write Your Name to the Blockchain: The Simple Guide to Writing your First Smart Contract Organised by Blockchain Infrastructure Group. Partnered with SGInnovate This workshop is a hands-on walkthrough demo, where you will write your name to the blockchain (either the real one, or the testnet). We will be introducing you to the core concepts of blockchains, and the real practical knowledge required to successfully develop and deploy a contract to two blockchains. Date : 11 July 2018, WednesdayTime : 6.30pm to 10.30pmVenue : 32 Carpenter Street, Singapore 059911 We will be writing the simplest smart contract, to store your name on the QTUM testnet blockchains (you are welcome to write to the real one if you're really rich). You can't learn all of the specifics of smart contracts in a day, but you will get a big picture of how the building blocks of critical tools like the Ethereum Virtual Machine (EVM), Solidity, and blockchains like QTUM come together. 6:30pm - Registration 6:45pm - Overview lecture on key concepts in Blockchain, Intro and QTUM 7:05pm - Hands-on code-along for writing a smart contract 7:30pm - Deploying your smart contract to the QTUM blockchain You will need to bring a laptop with Google Chrome and Metamask installed. You are also welcome to just watch and follow along, and understand the big picture of how all of this comes together. We are a strictly developer-focused meetup, and would discourage the discussion of price or trading during the session.

events.name: Rise of Security Threats in Crypto Exchange
events.description: Recent case of $30 million stolen from top Korean Exchange, dampens trust and threatens the future of crypto trading.Call out to blockchain fans and blockchain entrepreneurs!Join us on Wednesday July 11th for our latest BlockAsia Singapore Meetup. At this event, we are glad to have one speaker from Huobi Group, Gaven from BlockOrigin and Michael Ran from Lightyear (Stellar's for-profit arm), who will analyse their views about the security problems of crypto exchanges based on the exchange side, the investor side as well as the technological engineer side. We are also excited to invite extra one speaker from Digifinex and a lawyer, together with our three speakers, to participate into our panel discussion. AGENDA:6:30-6:50 PM: Guest Registration and Networking 6:50-7:00 PM: Opening Remarks and Introduction to BlockAsia by Ken N,Managing Director of BlockAsia and Huobi Global Elite 7:00-7:20 PM: Security Concerns of Crypto Exchanges presentation byone speaker from Huobi Group 7:20-7:30 PM: Break 7:30-7:50 PM: Protect from Security Threats of Crypto Exchangespresentation by Gaven from BlockOrigin 7:50-20:10 PM: Tech Overview of Security System presentation byMichael Ran from Stellar 8:10-8:40 PM: Panel Discussion on the Security Issues of Exchanges 8:40-9:00 PM: Networking There will be special airdrops by Huobi Global Elite. "" Please add our wechat customer service ID: blockasiaThen you will be invited into our wechat group for the meetup!As well as join our telegram group: https://t.me/block_asia ""Terms and Conditions Apply
events.location: Bittemple, 5F Republic Plaza, 9 Raffles Place, Singapore
